00018 namespace BulletHell.Game.Library.Behavior
00019 {
00020     public class ShootingTargetBehavior : Behavior
00021     {
00022         private double x;
00023         private double y;
00024 
00025         private float targetAngle;
00026 
00027         public ShootingTargetBehavior(EnemyPlaneObj parent)
00028             : base(parent)
00029         {
00030             behaviorState = BehaviorState.ShootTarget;
00031         }
00032 
00033         public override Behavior clone(EnemyPlaneObj newParent)
00034         {
00035             return new ShootingTargetBehavior(newParent);
00036         }
00037 
00038         internal override void Update(Map map, GameTime gameTime)
00039         {
00040             x = map.hero.position.X - parent.position.X;
00041             y = map.hero.position.Y - parent.position.Y;
00042 
00043             targetAngle = (float)(Math.PI * 2 - Math.Atan2(y, x));
00044 
00045             if (_GLOBAL.Debug)
00046             {
00047                 double degree = (((targetAngle) / (Math.PI * 2)) * 360 + 360) % 360;
00048                 map.TargetShooting = "Hero: (" + map.hero.position.X + ", " + map.hero.position.Y +
00049                     ")\nEnemy: (" + parent.position.X + ", " + parent.position.Y +
00050                     ")\nDegree: " + degree +
00051                     "\ntargetAngle: " + targetAngle;
00052             }
00053 
00054             /* Lerp adds unpredictability to the bullet */
00055             parent.shootMulti(parent.bulletSelection, parent.BulletType[parent.bulletSelection].BulletAmount,
00056             MathHelper.Pi / 180 * MathHelper.Lerp(parent.BulletType[parent.bulletSelection].BulletDensity * 0.9f, 
00057                 parent.BulletType[parent.bulletSelection].BulletDensity * 1.1f,
00058                 (float)rand.NextDouble()), targetAngle);
00059         }
00060     }
00061 }
